intro: Ferulago capillaris, commonly known as the slender ferula, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Ferulago capillaris is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
